post_text: Please Read Important Information
text: Please Read Important Information

post_text:
Attn: Parents/Guardians:

Late this afternoon we were notified by the Washington County Health Department that we have an individual at John Evans Middle School identified as being a positive case of SARS-CoV-2/Coronavirus (COVID-19).

Due to our contact tracing we were able to immediately identify and isolate all individuals who are considered close contacts. We have contacted all close contacts and their parents/guardians. The close contacts will also be contacted by the Washington County Health Department.

Close contacts are defined as those being closer than 6’ for 15 minutes or longer. People that are NOT close contacts are at low risk of developing COVID-19.

Due to how late in the day it was we were not able to send letters home today but buildings will send out a letter tomorrow if your child was in a classroom, bus or cohort group with this individual.

post_text: Potosi R3 staff have been working hard to prepare for tomorrow!We are excited to see all of our students tomorrow.Welcome back to school!
text: Potosi R3 staff have been working hard to prepare for tomorrow!We are excited to see all of our students tomorrow.Welcome back to school!

post_text:
Potosi R-3 School District is excited to welcome our students back to school on Monday, August 24th! Our staff have been preparing for this day since March and cannot wait to see our kids again.

Please remember that if your child is displaying any symptoms of COVID-19 illness, do not send them to school.

Please encourage your child to wear a mask in areas they are unable to social distance like hallways and buses. As a community we can all do our part to slow the spread of this virus.

Have a great weekend!

Have a great weekend!

post_text:
If you have enrolled your child in virtual school and have indicated your child needs a Chromebook, you may pick it up at the building where your child attends Friday from 8:00 a.m. - 3:00 p.m. or Saturday from 8:00 a.m. - 12:00 p.m. A parent or guardian must be present to sign the documents.

Insurance for the Chromebook is available. For students in grades K-6, the protection plan is $10 per electronic device. For students in grades 7-12, the protection plan is $30 per electronic device with a $5 discount for every additional child in grades 7-12.

post_text:
The Washington County Health Department is announcing a Public Health Alert due to a possible COVID- 19 community exposure.
Prior to being diagnosed, a COVID-19 positive guest of a student attended the following event:
Potosi High School Graduation in Potosi, MO on June 27th 2020.
The Potosi R-3 School District has been notified and are working closely with the Health Department to notify the public.
Close contacts of the case have been notified; however, any person attending the event should diligently monitor for symptoms of COVID-19 through July 11th. Close contact is defined as being within 6 feet of a confirmed case for at least 15 minutes.
Persons who are NOT close contacts are at a low risk for developing COVID-19. If you attended the event but are NOT a close contact, you do NOT need to quarantine unless you develop symptoms. If you become ill, please contact your Healthcare provider.
The State of Missouri has a hotline number that you can contact at 877-435-8411 and speak with a COVID-19 expert.

post_text:
On behalf of the Board of Education, I am very pleased to announce that Mr. Alex McCaul will be the new Superintendent for the Potosi R-3 School District. Mr. McCaul is the current Superintendent of the Kingston K-14 School District, and an alumnus of the Potosi R-3 School District. Mr. McCaul has a background in both education and business and has been a leader, friend, and positive example to many in our community. The Board is excited that he has accepted the offer to lead the R-3 District as it endeavors to offer a quality education for the students in our wonderful District.

In the near future, Mr. McCaul will be formally introduced to the District's staff members and begin his journey in fulfilling his dream of becoming a permanent member of the R-3 Team that "Loves Purple and Lives Gold".

RD
text:
On behalf of the Board of Education, I am very pleased to announce that Mr. Alex McCaul will be the new Superintendent for the Potosi R-3 School District. Mr. McCaul is the current Superintendent of the Kingston K-14 School District, and an alumnus of the Potosi R-3 School District. Mr. McCaul has a background in both education and business and has been a leader, friend, and positive example to many in our community. The Board is excited that he has accepted the offer to lead the R-3 District as it endeavors to offer a quality education for the students in our wonderful District.

In the near future, Mr. McCaul will be formally introduced to the District's staff members and begin his journey in fulfilling his dream of becoming a permanent member of the R-3 Team that "Loves Purple and Lives Gold".

RD

post_text:
R-3 Board of Education Vacancy Filled

After formal interviews of interested candidates, the Board of Education selected Rebekah Jones to fill the vacancy on the Board vacated by Kathy Silvey. Mrs. Jones is a mother of two district children, and is currently employed as Chief Operating Officer at Great Mines Health Center. In this position she oversees 60 employees and manages a budget of 8.5 million dollars in revenue.

The Board welcomes Mrs. Jones to her new position and looks forward to working with her in her new role as a member of the R-3 Board of Education.

The Board welcomes Mrs. Jones to her new position and looks forward to working with her in her new role as a member of the R-3 Board of Education.

Parents,

On Sunday night the Potosi R-3 District Administration became aware of a possible threat at Potosi High School. Law Enforcement has been contacted and the suspected student and their family have been notified. The student will not be in attendance at school as the investigation is ongoing. The Potosi R-3 School District is committed to student safety and will provide any updates as needed with this situation.

Thank You
Potosi R-3 Administration

post_text:
Statement from the Potosi R-III Board of Education.

The Board of Education and Dr. McCue have mutually agreed to part ways, his last day with the District is August 9, 2019. The Board would like to thank Dr. McCue for his service to the District and wishes him well in his future professional pursuits. The Board welcomes back Mr. Randy Davis who will serve as Interim Superintendent. The Board is committed to a succession plan and superintendent search in a manner which ensures a smooth transition for our staff, students, and families. We see this as an opportunity to regroup, re-energize and refocus on our shared mission to serve students.
text:
Statement from the Potosi R-III Board of Education.

The Board of Education and Dr. McCue have mutually agreed to part ways, his last day with the District is August 9, 2019. The Board would like to thank Dr. McCue for his service to the District and wishes him well in his future professional pursuits. The Board welcomes back Mr. Randy Davis who will serve as Interim Superintendent. The Board is committed to a succession plan and superintendent search in a manner which ensures a smooth transition for our staff, students, and families. We see this as an opportunity to regroup, re-energize and refocus on our shared mission to serve students.

post_text:
Potosi R-3 Bond Update

Our final rates feature an interest rate of 3.00% for maturities March 1, 2021, through March 1, 2024, with reoffered yields ranging from 1.70% to 1.90%. The bonds maturing March 1, 2025, through March 1, 2039, carry a 5.00% interest rate with reoffered yields from the March 1, 2024 call date ranging from 2.00% to 2.35%. This plan produces a reoffering premium of $480,925.50, which produces $60,495 greater revenue than what was projected at the May 30, 2019 board meeting. The average interest rate of 4.898% is unchanged; however, the highest reoffered yield of 2.35% is well below the limit of 2.60%.

Some bond issue roofing projects are already underway at the Elementary School. This is one of four buildings roofing projects that we plan to complete this summer. The bond projects will be completed in phases due to specific need completion times and logistics of the school year.
We are excited to get these projects underway.

A BIG “Thank You” to our community for your support of our children’s education through the bond issue.

post_text: We are happy to announce the Potosi R-3 School District Scored a Perfect 100% on its annual bus safety inspections from the Missouri State Highway Patrol Motor Vehicle Inspection Division. Dr. McCue noted, student’s safety is a top priority here at Potosi R-3. Potosi operates 34 buses, traveling over 1600 miles, and transporting over 1800 students a day. We take great care in making sure our children are safe.

post_text:
Missouri State Teachers Foundation February Classroom Grant winners

Congratulations to Melinda Saunders from Potosi Elementary for winning February’s $100 Classroom Grant from the Missouri State Teachers Foundation!
“Our school district has implemented a new Tutoring Program called TAP which will allow every student in our district to have the opportunity to stay for tutoring after school with transportation provided,” Saunders wrote in her application. “I would use the $100.00 to purchase STEM activities for the students to use during tutoring. STEM activities will allow the students the opportunity to work together as a team to explore, research, experiment, and use communication skills together to work to solve the task given. STEM allows the ability for all students, at-risk and high flyers, to use what they already know along with the new knowledge learned to successfully complete each task as they follow steps to complete the project.”

Congratulations again, Melinda!
text:
Missouri State Teachers Foundation February Classroom Grant winners

Congratulations to Melinda Saunders from Potosi Elementary for winning February’s $100 Classroom Grant from the Missouri State Teachers Foundation!
“Our school district has implemented a new Tutoring Program called TAP which will allow every student in our district to have the opportunity to stay for tutoring after school with transportation provided,” Saunders wrote in her application. “I would use the $100.00 to purchase STEM activities for the students to use during tutoring. STEM activities will allow the students the opportunity to work together as a team to explore, research, experiment, and use communication skills together to work to solve the task given. STEM allows the ability for all students, at-risk and high flyers, to use what they already know along with the new knowledge learned to successfully complete each task as they follow steps to complete the project.”

Congratulations again, Melinda!

A BIG THANK YOU TO BIG SMILES FOR COMING TO POTOSI ELEMENTARY THIS WEEK!

Big Smiles is an in-school dental program designed to address today’s student's dental needs. Their innovative model offers state of the art dental care to students in comfortable, familiar surroundings of their school; keeping them in class and learning.

Easy and convenient for parents at no cost to them.

post_text: We want to say Big “Thank You” to all the parents, relatives and community members for making our Book Drive a huge success. We collected over 3000 books that will be given to elementary and intermediate school children to help build their Home Libraries. This is a continuation of our focus on growing a Love of Books and Reading in our children. Reading is fundamental for children to reach their potential and follow their Dreams.
text: We want to say Big “Thank You” to all the parents, relatives and community members for making our Book Drive a huge success. We collected over 3000 books that will be given to elementary and intermediate school children to help build their Home Libraries. This is a continuation of our focus on growing a Love of Books and Reading in our children. Reading is fundamental for children to reach their potential and follow their Dreams.

post_text:
Creating a LOVE of READING and BOOKS

Here at Potosi, we want to create and foster a HUGE LOVE of READING and BOOKS within our students. We are giving our elementary and intermediate students a home library to decorate and a book to bring home. Our goal is to fill their libraries with fun books that will inspire them to love to read. We hope that this will also inspire family members, friends and community members to help with our goal of creating a HUGE LOVE of READING and BOOKS in our students. Giving students their own books to collect and read builds enthusiasm and helps cultivate a lifelong love of reading. Reading is the fundamental skill that will allow all children to reach their potential and follow their DREAMS.

Students who are enrolled will also receive a breakfast snack of donuts, muffins, fruit, milk, and juice.

Come join us for Summer School 5/29 thru 6/25. Enrollment applications are on our website at www.potosir3.org or see your school counselor.

post_text: It is Dude Be Nice Week (DBN) at Potosi R-3 School District. DBN is a platform to inspire young people to build a positive community. It is a week to focus on kindness, understanding, helping, caring and promoting a positive school culture. The PHS Student Council has extended the activities to all of our Potosi R-3 School buildings. Theme days and activities are planned throughout the week. The theme this year is "In a world where you can be anything, be kind!"

post_text:
Potosi R-3 would like to address our community and the tragedy that occurred at Kingston K-14 this morning. We want to communicate our sincerest and deepest sympathies to all family, friends and staff affected by this event in our neighboring district.

Potosi R-3 has made available services if needed, which may aid in Kingston’s process through this tragic event. We have also initiated our Crisis Intervention Teams within our buildings if needed to address any emotional needs of our students.

If you have any questions or are in need of assistance please do not hesitate to contact any building office.

Respectfully,

Shawn McCue Ed. D.
Superintendent of Schools

Monday the District received information regarding a potential threat at the High School made via social media. The information was unsubstantiated. We would like to notify everyone that all concerns and issues were addressed immediately and actions have been taken to preserve the safety of all our students. The District is working with Law Enforcement and will continue to do so in order to maintain safety. Our top priority is the safety of our students and we take these situations very seriously.

Thank you.

post_text:
Potosi High School is pleased to partner with our Washington County first-responders to practice emergency response procedures and to evaluate and improve upon the effectiveness of those procedures. A county-wide disaster drill will be practiced at different locations on Monday, October 16. The leaders in Washington County have adopted a joint Mass Casualty Response Plan and triage system of care that will be utilized during the drill.

PHS students will participate in a school-wide tornado drill at 9:00 a.m. and then continue with their normal school routine and schedule. The high school gymnasium will be utilized by first responders as a triage location. Selected theater students, with parent permission, will participate in the drill as patients.
Potosi R-3 is pleased to partner with the community and provide a facility to practice this important drill.

post_text:
Thank you Belgrade State Bank and loyal Potosi Trojans customers.

Belgrade State Bank presents a $1,200.00 check to the Potosi R-III School District Superintendent. This donation was made possible through a rewards program that the bank offers its customers. If they sign up for a Potosi Trojan debit card, the bank will donate 3 cents per purchase made with the card to the school district. From left to right: Dr. Shawn McCue, Superintendent, Jennie Sandefur, Andrea Ricketts, Ashley Kincaid from Belgrade State Bank.
